intro: Sclerolaena eurotioides, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers develop into small, puffball-like seed heads. Sclerolaena eurotioides is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
